Description: Fragment of rim of North Ionian pottery bowl. Clay light brownish paint greyish and metallic. Some additions in purplish red and cream. Inside glazed, with red band lined in white well below rim. On outside, frieze: bird to right (head turned) and hindpart of a goat to right, all in silhouette; rosette and tongue ornaments at rim, small cross ornaments in field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 205, N8): "Transitional Middle/Late Wild Goat style; same ware as N6-7. For shape see Fairbanks, Boston Cat. No. 313-315 pl. 33. For the exaggerated rump (or wing) of beast on right cf. the birds on bowl from Aigina, E. Walter-Kardyi in Alt-Agina II 1, 16 no. 82 pl. 6 (there classed as Thasian). Style: cf. also the "skyphos-krater" from Old Smyrna in Akurgal, Eski Izmir I 45, 123 (German ed. pp.48, 143) pl. 112b.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 205, no N8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.119)
